title: Personality and skills
description:
Big Five is a personality frame considered universal.
Among organizational psychologists, it is a consensus in terms of effectiveness
of assessment. Based on it, several studies and meta-studies were sought,
focusing especially on general potential, leadership potential, psychometric
methods, selection and others specific to each attribute or group of
attributes (such as cognitive skills, interpersonal skills, need for
achievement, among others) in order to seek a nomenclature that made more
sense, thus creating a mixed frame of personality and skill. (Excerpt of Mindmatch report.)

children.value: Personality and skills

Big Five is a personality frame considered universal.
Among organizational psychologists, it is a consensus in terms of effectiveness
of assessment. Based on it, several studies and meta-studies were sought,
focusing especially on general potential, leadership potential, psychometric
methods, selection and others specific to each attribute or group of
attributes (such as cognitive skills, interpersonal skills, need for
achievement, among others) in order to seek a nomenclature that made more
sense, thus creating a mixed frame of personality and skill.
(Excerpt of Mindmatch report.)

props.description: Capacity to formulate concepts, determine problems and deal with abstractions.
props.title: Conceptual thinking

children.value: Formulating strategies and giving visibility to your work and company for the team and other stakeholders.

props.description: Capacity for reflection, self-analysis and observation of their own states, strengths and weaknesses.
props.title: Reflection

children.value: Accelerating learning and offer insights to your position and sector.

props.description: Capacity to create new things and innovate; escape from the commonplace.
props.title: Creative thinking

children.value: Developing innovating solutions and thinking about new ways to solve problems.

props.description: Capacity for self-motivation in the search for high standards and growth.
props.title: Ambition

children.value: Always seeks excellence in the projects and only having the best as reference.

props.description: Capacity to empathize and take other people’s opinions and feelings into account in interactions and decisions.
props.title: Consideration for the others

children.value: Helping people in difficult moments and guaranteeing team satisfaction with the work environment.

props.description: Capacity to analyze diverse information, numbers, data, etc.; process this information in a logical manner; and coming to informed conclusions.
props.title: Analytical capacity

children.value: Analyzing root-causes of problems and manipulating numbers and diverse information.

props.description: Capacity to expose ideas directly; not feeling intimidated by the environment.
props.title: Assertiveness

children.value: Exposing opinions that other people end up avoiding and increasing communication efficiency.

props.description: Capacity to act even with high levels of uncertainty without stumbling.
props.title: Risk taking

children.value: Acting against the status quo in order to ensure that the organization does not settle.

props.description: Capacity to adapt to different environments in a subtle way.
props.title: Flexibility

children.value: Performing faster after changes and being able to be reallocated with greater ease.

props.description: Capacity to start actions without the need for third party intervention; take the lead.
props.title: Initiative

children.value: Acting even when the direction is not clear and having a higher execution output.

props.description: Capacity to communicate verbally and clearly; conveying ideas through words to individuals or audiences.
props.title: Communication

children.value: Explaining difficult concepts to the group and clearly transmit ideas to several people.

props.description: Capacity to keep things organized; control and add structure.
props.title: Planning and organization

children.value: Formulating and implementing processes and performing with excellence in the work flow.

props.description: Capacity to persuade others to behave differently than they would without intervention.
props.title: Influence

children.value: Selling ideas to internal and external clients and conquering resources for the execution of the projects.

props.description: Capacity to stay calm in pressure situations and to control emotional ups and downs.
props.title: Emotional stability

children.value: Maintaining the team focused during turbulences and keeping the work going even with many external interferences.

props.description: Capacity to understand social situations, collaborate and solve conflicts in a harmonious manner.
props.title: Facilitation

children.value: Solving organizational conflicts and ensuring teamwork in a team.

props.description: Capacity to interact and create relationships with different people; ease in social environments.
props.title: Sociability

children.value: Creating networking with stakeholders and connecting people.
Back home
